alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of WEST CENTRAL Maine, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over dirt roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. This will cause small stream and creek flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and washout of North Woods dirt roads. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Billy-Jack Depot and Baker Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
